subject: RE: [junit] Junit and mock objects
msgSnippet: Hi Chris Ok, sorry for misunderstanding your answer. The problem is that I can not make these methods Instance methods because these methods are used to create
messageBody:
Hi Chris



Ok, sorry for misunderstanding your answer.



The problem is that I can not make these methods Instance methods
because these methods are used to create an instance of the object.

That is why there is no public constructor in these classes.



This is causing me quite a headache.

First of all I will have to leave these static methods out of the
interface which means that they can't be used in the mockObject.

Second of all, in Andrew's example he does this:



public class MyNetworkInterfaceImpl implements MyNetworkInterface {

public void OneOfTheInterfaceMethods() {
delegate.OneOfTheInterfaceMethods() ;
}

private NetworkInterface m_delegate = new NetworkInterface();
}



I can't do this because the constructor of the class that I'm trying to
mock is not public. I also can not do this because of the above
mentioned problem with static methods creating an instance of the class.

Its also going to be quite problematic to use this class that implements
the interface. Say for example I want to create a new instance by called
one of these static methods:

MyNetworkInterfaceImpl netInt = MyNetworkInterfaceImpl.getLocalHost();



The static getLocalHost method of NetworkInterface would return an
NetworkInterface object so getLocalHost in MyNetworkInterfaceImpl should
return a MyNetworkInterfaceImpl object. In order to return this object I
will need to create a private/protected MyNetworkInterfaceImpl
constructor that takes a NetworkInterface as an argument so that the
private field (shown in the example above) can be set.



I know my example above is confusing but this whole issue _IS_ confusing
to me.

Any help would be appreciated.

Thanks

Pico



________________________________

From: Chris Dollin [mailto:kers@...]
Sent: 22 February 2005 09:33 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Junit and mock objects



On Tuesday 22 February 2005 06:40, Pico Geyer wrote:
> Thanks for your suggestions.

> Unless I'm doing something wrong, your suggestion does not work.
>
> I add the method to the interface and when I try to implement it as a
> static method I get this error:
>
> myMethod() in NetworkIntImp cannot implement myMethod() in NetworkInt;
> overriding method is static

You implement it as an *instance* method, not a static method.

--
Chris "electric hedgehog" Dollin
